context: he contemporary social and political context is different, but the ambiguity and indeterminacy of voting rights are not. state voter id laws, limits on early voting, restrictions on registration, voter roll purges, disenfranchisement, and gerrymandering have become ordinary yet systemic barriers to minority participation. voting rights are again being challenged and new de jure and de facto voter suppression techniques are again on the rise. yet so too are the number of political organizations attempting to build, sustain, and employ the strategic capacity necessary for successful legal mobilization.
